titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the William Van Duyn Tobacco Advertisement Collection
titlestmt.author: Finding aid revised by Toby A. Appel

publicationstmt.publisher: Medical Historical Library, Harvey Cushing / John Hay Whitney Medical Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 03:00

did.unittitle: William Van Duyn Tobacco Advertisement Collection

repository.corpname: Medical Historical Library, Harvey Cushing / John Hay Whitney Medical Library

did.abstract: William Van Duyn, a former smoker, collected advertisements and news articles related to tobacco, especially to cigarette smoking. These include cigarette advertisements by company and brand; other forms of tobacco advertisements including billboards (photographs taken by Van Duyn), merchandise catalogs, and sponsorship of racing; and newspaper and magazine articles and ephemera related to the anti-smoking movement and tobacco regulation and litigation.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Yale does not own copyright. Almost all the advertisements in this collection are under copyright to the tobacco companies.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: William Van Duyn Tobacco Advertisement Collection. Cushing/Whitney Medical Library, Yale University, New Haven, CT

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The original finding aid was compiled by a student. Binders after 67 have since been renumbered.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: This collection of magazine advertisements, ephemera, articles, and photographs, was begun in 1994 by William Van Duyn, then a resident of Voluntown, Connecticut, who became fascinated by the ubiquity and deceptiveness of tobacco advertisements as a byproduct of his own effort to quit smoking. In addition to collecting, he founded a website to help others to quit. Van Duyn organized his advertisements, etc. into labeled looseleaf binders with the overall title "Gnikoms!" for smoking spelled backwards. At the time of his gift, Van Duyn and his family were living in Guilford and about to move to Canada.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The first and main part of the collection contains cigarette advertisements from popular magazines arranged by tobacco company, brand, and year. The companies are those in business when Van Duyn was collecting (1994-2002), not the original nor current companies. Many advertisements in this section can be identified by magazine and date. Although the advertisements are predominantly from American companies, there are also advertisements of British and Continental brands. One can trace advertising campaigns by different companies in different eras. The second part of the collection contains advertisements for cigars and other forms of tobacco, examples of cigarette packaging, photographs by Van Duyn of billboards and other outdoor advertisements for cigarettes, images of cigarette sponsorship of auto racing and other sports, and advertisements in which smoking is used to promote other products. The third part of the collection includes magazine and newspaper articles on legislation limiting smoking, litigation against the tobacco companies, and the settlement of 1997 with state attorney-generals. There are anti-smoking brochures and advertisements from the American Cancer Society, the National Cancer Institute, the American Lung Association, and other organizations, and advertisements for products and methods to quit smoking.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two series, Regular and Oversize. Each series is subdivided into three subseries: 1. Magazine advertisements for cigarettes by brand. 2. Other tobacco advertisements. 3. Anti-smoking movement and tobacco politics.

did.unittitle: Magazine advertisements for cigarettes by brand

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Organized by company, brand, and date. See Series 2, Oversize, for additional advertisements of many of the brands below. Tobacco companies were those existing between 1994 and 2002, the years of Van Duyn's collecting.

did.unittitle: American Tobacco Company (Brown & Williamson): (Herbert) Tareyton, Malibu, Colony, Half and Half, Bull Durham, American Lights, Montclair, Iceberg, Maryland 00's, Riviera, Silva Thins, Long Johns, Tall

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: On Tareytown, see also oversize binder 130.

scopecontent.p: For Kool, see also oversize binders 131-132.

Miscellaneous. brands: Fatima, WDC Triangle Pipes, Melachrino, Pet Cigarettes, Mogul, Spud, Fifty-Six, Milo, Velvet, Nestor, Vogue, Domino, Chelsea, Regent, King Sano, Sherman's, Dunhill, Gauloises, Cartier, Springwater, Calume, Djarum, Sampoerna, Rave, Natural American Spirit.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: For Virginia Slims, see also oversize binder 156.

did.unittitle: R. J. Reynolds: Camel --Bar and music promotions

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Beginning of binder includes "Camel Roadhouse Tour" events for motorcyclists.

did.unittitle: R. J. Reynolds: Kamel. 1996–2000; Moonlight Tobacco Co. Brands: Metro Slim Lights, Sedona, Jumbos, City, North Star, Politix.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: For Kamel, see also oversize binder 164.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: For Winston, see also oversize binders 167-169.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: For Salem, see also oversize binders 165-166.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ogden's, Craven "A", Minor, Player's, Du Maurier, State Express 555, Greys, Wills Three Castles, Passing Clouds, John Cotton, Marcovitch Black & White, Abdulla, Sobranie, Embassy, Rothman, Dunhill, Silk Cut, Benson and Hedges, St. Moritz. Includes government health warnings. The 1898 item is an advertisement from the Graphic for Ogden's Guinea-Gold cigarettes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Various languages, among them Arabic, Hebrew, Russian, and German. Brands include Merit, Parliament, Carlton, Chesterfield, L&M, Winston, Camel, Lucky Strike, Golf, Stuyvesant, Kent, Dunhill, R1, HB, West, Davidoff, Philip Morris, Players P&S, Craven "A", and others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: See also oversize binder 56, and oversize binders 175-183.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Magazine advertisements for brands of cigars and miscellaneous articles about cigars. Some German advertisements.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Among brands represented are Three Castles, Old Holborn, Rizla (Riz la croix), Job (including copies of 19th century posters by Alphonse Mucha), ez-wider, Bambu, Prince Albert, Drum, Velvet. Some foreign advertisements. Collection includes some original packaging for tobacco and rolling papers. At the beginning of the notebook are yellow pages and classified advertisements for cigarettes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Advertisements for tobacco products including Mail Pouch Tobacco, Skoal, Copenhagen snuff, Silver Creek, Timber Wolf, Rooster, Red Man, Redwood snuff, Granger, Kodiak. At the beginning, there is some material opposing chewing and snuff, including two pamphlets by the National Cancer Institute. .

did.unittitle: Cigarette pack design, cigarette girls, store displays, street ads, stadium ads, etc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Images are mostly from magazines and newspapers. Includes popular articles on advertising campaigns and copies of posters. Some material in languages other than English.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Original packaging for single packs of cigarettes and cartons for multiple packs of cigarettes. Various brands.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gifts for taking the "Smokers Survey"; Virginia Slims Wear; Benson & Hedges Collection; Parliament; "Merit Awards."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Marlboro signs, gear, sweepstakes for travel, discounts.

did.unittitle: "Camel Cash" and catalogs of Camel merchandise

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Pages from a booklet of collectibles, including Joe Camel items, for Camel's 85th birthday.

did.unittitle: R. J. Reynolds promotions; Moonlight Tobacco Co.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Doral, Winston, Vantage, Salem, Kamel; Moonlight Tobacco Co. brands

did.unittitle: Tobacco company sponsorship of auto racing

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Images showing race cars and drivers sporting advertisements for cigarette brands, especially Marlboro; F1 race. Some German and Arabic.

did.unittitle: Tobacco company sponsorship of auto racing

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Images and articles showing race cars and drivers advertising other cigarette brands. Includes some articles on tobacco company support of races, especially the Formula 1 (F1) race. Some German and Arabic.

did.unittitle: Tobacco company sponsorship of auto racing teams and competitions

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Indy 500 and F1.

did.unittitle: Tobacco sponsorship of auto racing and competitions

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: NASCAR Winston Cup Series; cars sponsored by a variety of cigarette brands.

did.unittitle: Tobacco sponsorship of motorcycle races and other sports

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Besides motorcycles, includes boat races, model race cars, golf, tennis, and basketball

did.unittitle: Advertisements for duty-free cigarettes; various tobacco company promotions

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gifts for taking a "Smoker's Survey"; Natural American Spirit promotional material; Lucky Strike signs, Kool Official Gear (for racing); Capri, Savannah, Newport

did.unittitle: Older cigarette advertising images from the Web

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes early cigarette trade cards, Rameses, Melachrino, Egyptian Deities, Helmar, Murad, Omar, Fatima, Spud, Kool, Pall Mall, Tareyton, Raleigh, Lucky Strike, Camel, Chesterfield, Old Gold, Marlboro, Virginia Slims, Player's, Craven "A," and various other foreign brands. Some images are of items offered by e-Bay.

did.unittitle: Outdoor advertising: Photograph album, Part I

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs, presumably by William Van Duyn, of cigarette brands advertised on billboards, on taxis, and on other outdoor signs, as well as "No Smoking" signs and anti-smoking signs.

did.unittitle: Outdoor advertising: Photograph album, Part II
Outdoor advertising: Photograph album, Part III

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes the Winston "no additives" campaign.

did.unittitle: Outdoor advertising: Photograph album, Part IV
Outdoor advertising: Photograph album, Part V

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes some anti-smoking billboards, and some photographs of crushed cigarette pack litter.

did.unittitle: Outdoor advertising: Photograph album, Part VI

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Cigarette advertisements; store displays; more tobacco carton litter, antismoking billboards.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of issue. Drawing of a woman smoking on cover; Pall Mall advertisement on back showing "Yale Gate."

did.unittitle: Images of people smoking in advertisements for other products

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes galleries, shows, restaurants and lounges, cars, clothing, food, drink, cosmetics, and travel.

did.unittitle: Images of people smoking from magazine covers, posters (copies), and film and theater advertisements
History of tobacco; smoking in literature

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Excerpts of Georges Bizet, Carmen , Richard Klein, Cigarettes are Sublime ; Ernest Hemingway, For Whom the Bell Tolls, Tom Robbins, Still Life with Woodpecker, Mark Twain, "Concerning Tobacco"; James Thurber, "The Catbird Seat"; Stephen King, Night Shift; John Grisham, Runaway Jury; and others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: See also oversize binders 184-187.

did.unittitle: American Cancer Society and American Lung Association anti-smoking promotions

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes magazine advertisements, pamphlets, posters, signs, and stickers. Some of the ACS pamphlets feature Garry Trudeau's "Mr. Butts."

did.unittitle: Anti-smoking pamphlets by the National Cancer Institute, National Foundation for Cancer Research, American Lung Association, and other organizations
Anti-smoking signs, anti-smoking advertisements, and articles

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes life insurance, smoking on airplanes, and some advertisements sponsored by the American Cancer Society and American Lung Association.

did.unittitle: American Council on Science and Health anti-smoking reports, articles, and pamphlets
Tobacco politics and litigation, Part 1 -- newspaper and magazine articles

Tobacco politics and litigation, Part 10 -- newspaper and magazine articles

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Newspaper and magazine articles on smoking and children, especially teens. Includes discussion of bans on selling tobacco to children, "Mr. Butts," Campaign for Tobacco-Free Kids, and advertisements from tobacco companies claiming to discourage children from smoking

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials on the campaign against marketing to children by INFACT, a Boston-based corporate watchdog; INFACT boycott of Kraft and Nabisco. Many of the materials were addressed to William Van Duyn.

did.unittitle: "Opinion"--"Voices" from USA Today ; columns by George Will, Ann Landers, Ask Beth, and Molly Ivins; miscellaneous other articles

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes articles from Fortune on Philip Morris, American Tobacco Company's Lucky Strike, and R. J. Reynolds, 1936-1938.

did.unittitle: Popular science articles on smoking, cancer, and addiction

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Some material at the end by the American Anti-Vivisection Society on the abuse of animals in smoking experiments.

did.unittitle: Articles on the tobacco wars over federal regulation

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Some in Spanish.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Advertisements, especially from R. J. Reynolds, opposing new taxes on tobacco and "big government"; P. Lorillard advertisements against teen smoking; letters from tobacco companies to retail customers urging them to fight back; R. J. Reynold's "Survival Guide to the 90's"; copies of the Fortune article on R. J. Reynolds and on Lucky Strike, 1936-1938; postcards of Liggett & Myers and R. J. Reynolds headquarters and fields of tobacco, 1940s.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copy of Fortune article on Philip Morris, 1936; advertisements stating the company's position on smoking issues; Philip Morris' support of the arts; PM fight against hunger; PM advertisements to prevent underage smoking.

did.unittitle: Issues of magazines featuring articles on the tobacco wars

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Products to mitigate tobacco odor and teeth stains; obituaries of people who died from tobacco-related diseases; articles on the difficulty of quitting; secondhand smoke.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: People smoking, cigarette marketing in Germany and Russia, "safer" cigarettes, sales of tax-free cigarettes by Indian tribes, parodies of cigarette warning labels, and more.

did.unittitle: Smoking cessation system and product advertisements

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Smokenders, EasyQuit, Phaseout, Quit Smart, hypnosis, acupuncture, Andre Passébecq, Bantron, Zyban. In some cases, William Van Duyn signed up to receive mailings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Habitrol, Nicotrol, Merrell Dow (Lakeside Pharmaceuticals), Nicoderm, and Nicorette.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Dowbloads of a detailed tobacco history from Tobacco.org, a history of Joe Camel, Friends of Tobacco (pro-tobacco), Badvertising Institute (anti-smoking), Americans for Nonsmokers' Rights, and others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Truth (thetruth.com); Activist Massachusetts; ASH (Action on Smoking and Health (UK)).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: R. J. Reynolds, especially tests on the brand Eclipse; P. Lorillard.

did.unittitle: Websites: Tobacco Manufacturers' Association (UK) and Gallaher group (UK tobacco company)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Downloaded in 2000, but includes 1990s items.

did.unittitle: Websites: British American Tobacco (UK) and the Imperial Tobacco Group (UK)
Website: dirtcheapcig.com, "The Last Refuge of the Persecuted Smoker"
Magazine advertisements for cigarettes by brand

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Other brands include Multifilter, Saratoga, Players, Dave's, Spud, Paxton, and Alpine.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Advertisements from Great Britain and other countries.

did.unittitle: R. J. Reynolds: Kamel Red, Kamel Menthe; Moonlight Tobacco Co.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Kamel Red: "Established-1913; Re-established-1996."

did.unittitle: R. J. Reynolds: Doral, Vantage, Now, Bright, Tempo, Brandon, Real, More, Sterling, Magna

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Axton-Fisher Tobacco Company: Spud, Fleetwood; Riggio Tobacco Company: Regent; United States Tobacco Co.: King Sano; Natural Tobacco Company: Natural American Spirit; Kretek International: Djarum.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Sotheby, Slim Kings, Embassy, Consulate, Rothmans, Sobranie, du Maurier, Craven, Dunhill, St. Moritz, Peter Stuyvesant, Lambert & Butler.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Benson and Hedges, Silk Cut. Includes government anti-smoking advertisements.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Winston, Camel, Chesterfield, Lucky Strike, L&M, Pall Mall, Benson and Hedges, Pierre Cardin, Stuyvesant, Player's P&S, Craven "A", Dunhill, Gauloises, Kings, Kent, Astor, HB, Lord, West, Philip Morris, R1, Fortuna, SM, Nobel, and others. English, French, German, Spanish, Russian, Greek and other languages. Some Winston sponsorship of music and Camel merchandising of "adventure boots."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Lighters including Ronson, A.S.R, Zippo, Casco, and cigarette holder Dunhill De-Nicotea (some advertisements featuring doctors). Some advertisements for loose tobacco and rolling papers at the end.

did.unittitle: Other tobacco products: cigarillos, cigars, pipe tobacco, chewing tobacco, snuff

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Attractively designed full or double-page advertisements featuring the Marlboro name or M logo and information on local nightspots. . Many pages are from the New York Press and the Village Voice. Some are from the New Haven Advocate

did.unittitle: Camel-sponsored local newspaper guides to urban nightlife

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: From the Village Voice .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Smoking in advertisements for cars; cigarette brand advertisements on racing cars.

did.unittitle: Cigarettes in magazine advertisements for other products

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Drinks, clothing, toothpaste, cosmetics, food, insurance, etc.

did.unittitle: Magazine covers, movie advertisements, and songs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Magazine covers showing people smoking from Life , Saturday Evening Post , New York Press , Village Voice , and others; movie advertisements showing someone smoking; original sheet music (8 items and 2 duplicates) that features someone on the cover smoking, or a song that has some relation to cigarettes. Of special note is the sheet music for "Stormy Weather" (1933), first sung by Ethel Waters at the Cotton Club.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Anti-smoking articles, advertisements, cartoons, class-action suit information. Among organizations represented are AdBusters, the Food and Drug Administration, and the National Cancer Society Great American Smokeout. Includes British and Spanish articles from Select Magazine and Quo . The last part of the binder contains advertisements for smoking cessation products including Bantron, Health Information Center (Passabecq method), Habitrol, NicoDerm, Nicorette, Nicotrol, CigArrest, and Zyban.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Fortune articles on Philip Morris, Lucky Strike, Reynolds Tobacco, and by the advertising agency that that created Kool and the Kool penguin (original, not photocopies), 1930s; Outdoor Advertising Company marketing of billboards; miscellaneous articles and images showing smoking in a good light; response advertisements by tobacco companies to the litigation of the 1990s; and articles from the American Lawyer (1999), on what tobacco companies gained from the tobacco settlement of 1997.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Newspaper articles on the tobacco industry settlement of 1997, teen smoking, and other tobacco issues. Binder begins with "Alcohol and Tobacco," Fortune (1935), and "New Cigaret-Cancer Link" (1957).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Articles from Convenience Store News on tobacco issues, including not selling cigarettes to minors.
